intro: Crepis prenanthoides, commonly known as the slender goat's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, forming a cluster at the top of the stem. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in the summer months.
